segments.text: I think the woman is going to regret not paying attention to what’s happening around her.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The water is ruining the floor, and the children are about to hurt themselves.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: She’s so focused on that one plate that she can’t see the bigger picture.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The boy is going to fall, and the girl is going to get caught in the mess.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I feel frustrated just watching her ignore everything.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The children are being reckless, but she’s not even trying to stop them.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The water is just pouring and pouring, and she doesn’t care.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wish someone would step in and take control before it’s too late.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The whole situation is infuriating, and I can’t believe she’s letting it happen.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: She needs to wake up and see what’s really going on in her own kitchen.
segments.speaker: PAR
